result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy J Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randy J Larson in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM70.  Court recites argreement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea to Ct in 16CM70, Ct 2 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea in 16CM94.  

DE enters a plea of G to Ct 1, 16CM70-court will note but hold in abeyance for a one year period.  DE will enroll/complete the Rusk County DAIP, provide proof to the State, make all court appearances, keep address current with the court, bond continues.  If DE complies with all conditions, count will be dismissed, if non compliant, DE will return to court for sentencing.  

16CM94-DE will enter a plea of G, court will accept and find the DE guilty,  Court accepts the recommendations of the parties, will order CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  

If DE is enrolled and attending DAIP classes, DE/Atty will not need to attend hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Case settlement
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Demand for Discovery filed by the State

Final pre-trial on August 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
**This was reschuled as a plea/sentencing hearing on 9-14-17 at 10:00 am**
Jury trial - 12 person on October 5, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Review hearing on June 16, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Offer was presented, parties not in agreement with offer.  Court will set for one more RH.  Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Review hearing on May 26, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Petros states that DE called him yesterday and due to work he is unable to be here today.  Petros states that Friday's are usually good for him.  Set for another RH on 5-26-17 at 1:00 pm.  Case heard along with 16CM94.
Review hearing on March 17, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Review hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 08:00 am.
